author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
<@!892053833121923094> and I have been working a bit on getting my implementation to pass his reference tests.
And we have the following questions:
- The spec says `safeBlockHash: DATA, 32 Bytes - the "safe" block hash of the canonical chain under certain synchrony and honesty assumptions. This value MUST be either equal to or an ancestor of headBlockHash`
So we should (after potentially reorging due to the headblock) verify that the `safeBlock` is in the canonical chain right? In this case, should we return `INVALID` or an error?
- Imo we should assume the same for `finalizedBlockHash` (that is in the canonical chain after the potential reorg). This is not yet specified in the specs though (afaik). Also again should we return `INVALID` or an error in this case?
